body_content.explanation: a national park (= a large area of land protected by the government because of its natural beauty or because it has a special history) in the eastern part of England:
examples: The quiet village of Stokesby is situated on the River Bure, next to the Broads National Park - great if you're a keen boater.
The Broads Authority has to balance the needs of the local wildlife against the needs of the local people, local industry and tourism.
